title: Energy Down After Weak Factory Data — Energy Roundup
text:
Shares of energy companies fell after weak U.S. and euro-zone manufacturing data.

Oil futures came under pressure because of concerns that supplies will outstrip demand, now that Saudi Arabia has restored production in the wake of attacks on its oil infrastructure in September.

Natural-gas futures fell for the 11th straight session amid mounting concerns about a glut of the commodity.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 01, 2019 16:24 ET (20:24 GMT)
